title: AnonWallet_Net
author: AnonWallet_Net
created_time: July 11, 2022, 09:03:59 AMLast edit: August 17, 2022, 06:31:12 PM by AnonWallet_Net
content: Greetings to all,AnonWallet.Net is a cryptocurrency payment gateway created by a remote team of developers providing you an API to send and receive online payments on your website or application.Service features:Verification of identity is not requiredUser registration is simple, only the email address, a name which can be anything you choose, and a password. Your account can be protected by 2FA AuthenticatorGlobal CoverageThere is no country limitation. Our services can be accessed from anywhere.White-Label SolutionYour customers stay on your website to complete the payment. Your server will be notified every time a new payment is detected on your generated callback address, an easy and useful way to automate order completition on your software.Auto Forward Received PaymentsThis great feature is allowing you to set up a forward address on your generated callback addresses or invoices using the Merchant API.No hidden fees or chargebacksTransactions cannot be canceled or reversed on the blockchain, below you will find the fees taken by our Crypto API.INSTANT PAYMENT NOTIFICATIONS IPNThe Instant Payment Notifications system will send POST DATA to your website when you receive a payment to your callback address or invoice and when the payment status is changed: pending, complete.CURRENTLY SUPPORTED CURRENCIESBitcoin - BTCBitcoin Cash - BCHLitecoin - LTCDogecoin - DOGE  Ethereum - ETHNew currencies will be available soon!FEESDeposits to wallet  - 0%API payments to callback addresses or invoices - 1%Forward received payments - 1%Withdrawal funds - Network FeeCurrent network feesBitcoin BTC - 0.00002Bitcoin Cash BCH - 0.00002Litecoin LTC - 0.00003Ethereum - 0.0006Dogecoin DOGE - 1AnonWallet.Net is providing you with a fast and low-cost crypto API to anonymously accept online payments with the option to auto-forward every received payment to your personal wallet address.

comments.body: Quote from: AnonWallet_Net on July 11, 2022, 09:03:59 AMAuto Forward Received PaymentsIf someone overpays, is the refund process also covered by the 1% fee that you charge for incoming payments [+ another 1% for auto forwarding], or do we have to do that after receiving everything [1% fee + 1% fee + another TX fee]?Quote from: AnonWallet_Net on July 11, 2022, 09:03:59 AMCurrent network feesBitcoin BTC - 0.0004~Snipped~May I know which platform you're using to estimate network fees [you're "overestimating" it]?Care to explain why you have misleading stats on your website [it shrank, but I still don't believe those stats]?Yesterday it was:Quote from: http://web.archive.org/web/20220711124535/https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache%3AchDf3atHtDsJ%3Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fanonwallet.net%2F+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=us120k+Global Merchants900M+Micro Payments1400k+TransactionsAnd today is:Quote from: https://archive.ph/hWMVP#selection-281.0-371.1423k+Global Merchants320k+Forwarded Payments520k+Transactions25M+Micro Payments

comments.author: AnonWallet_Net
comments.body: Quote from: SFR10 on July 11, 2022, 01:32:06 PMQuote from: AnonWallet_Net on July 11, 2022, 09:03:59 AMAuto Forward Received PaymentsIf someone overpays, is the refund process also covered by the 1% fee that you charge for incoming payments [+ another 1% for auto forwarding], or do we have to do that after receiving everything [1% fee + 1% fee + another TX fee]?Quote from: AnonWallet_Net on July 11, 2022, 09:03:59 AMCurrent network feesBitcoin BTC - 0.0004~Snipped~May I know which platform you're using to estimate network fees [you're "overestimating" it]?Care to explain why you have misleading stats on your website [it shrank, but I still don't believe those stats]?Yesterday it was:Quote from: http://web.archive.org/web/20220711124535/https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache%3AchDf3atHtDsJ%3Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fanonwallet.net%2F+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=us120k+Global Merchants900M+Micro Payments1400k+TransactionsAnd today is:Quote from: https://archive.ph/hWMVP#selection-281.0-371.1423k+Global Merchants320k+Forwarded Payments520k+Transactions25M+Micro PaymentsHello,Thanks for paying attention to our platform!Let me answer your questions.If someone is overpaying an invoice, the amount overpaid remains in your account (in case of not using a forward address), if the invoice has a forward address attached, our charge is 1% for the API incoming payment + 1% for using the forward address feature + TX Fee ( Thanks for your specification about network fees, we have changed them)For example: Receiving 0.005 BTC payment on a callback address, from this amount we charge 1% (0.00005 BTC), merchant remains with 0.00495 BTC. If the callback address has a forward address, another 1% (0.0000495 BTC) is deducted from 0.00495 BTC + the TX Fee (0.00003 BTC). The merchant will receive at his personal address 0.0048705 BTC. Withdraw network fees are changed, we will try to keep them as low as possible.About the stats, as we are a new payment gateway on the market, the numbers are different and at this moment displayed stats are for marketing only. You don't have to believe them.We have added to our tasks to add more features about overpaid or underpaid invoices.Have a great day!

comments.body: Greetings, Testing Instant Payment Notification IPN on developing.Merchant is now able to test their IPN handlers with a feature added to the Merchant API section.Test IPN is a new option for merchants to send demo instant payment notifications where they are able to set the status, address, amount, and cryptocurrency POST Data to be sent.This feature helps developers to test their system to receive the status of payments.
